website_summaries.verdict: This Weber grill is as good as any traditional grill without many of the drawbacks.
pros: Aside from offering some of the best features in the electric grill market, it’s also simple to assemble and easy to clean
Its 1560W heating element evenly sears food and still produces the unique flavors of traditional grilling
cons: A bit pricey, but the specs fit the bill
Lack of thermometer is a big question mark

customer_reviews.title: Don't Miss Charcoal or Propane Gas
customer_reviews.text: I have cooked with charcoal grills and propane grills, with Weber products and non-Weber products. I am currently living in an area where 'open-flame' grills are not permitted, so decided to see how a Weber's electric grill would work. It is GREAT! Follow the directions to let it warm up for 20 minutes before cooking and you will be good to go. Meat chars very well, tastes great. One outstanding quality of the grill is that it is more consistent in terms of heat produced than a flamed grill, so you can get your timing down literally to the minute for many things you grill repeatedly. Terrific product.
customer_reviews.author: Teknisk Läsare

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!! I did install a temperature gauge on ...
customer_reviews.text: So I would have never thought an electric grill would cook well or last long enough to justify expense. Well I have purchased several; as gifts, for home, for camp, for camper...etc. FANTASTIC!! I did install a temperature gauge on all of them as this is a very nice feature and needed (in my opinion) when cooking chicken, pork, fish, shrimp or steak. Have no idea why this is not a standard feature but an easy fix. Great no having to worry about charcoal or gas.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Weber will always be first!
customer_reviews.text: A+++. Love this. No charcoal, no gas, just plug it in and start cooking. Only minimal assembly required. The other night my wife pre-seasoned four steaks. I put a hunk of hickory wood directly in one corner of the grill. I dropped the steaks on the grill and they were the best we've ever eaten. The only assembly required is lining up the top with the bottom and inserting two cotter pins. In addition the handle must be screwed in place. I followed somebody's else's review abd screwed in the handle first. Made life a little bit easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast, cooks the meat evenly and the grill is very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this electric grill because the condo association doesn’t allow gas grills. At first I was hesitant to buy it but after reading some reviews I decided to give it a try, and I must honestly say I am truly happy with it. It heats up fast and cooks the meat evenly with the same taste as if you cooked it on a gas grill. It looks great on my deck and doesn’t take up much room. I would definitely recommend this grill to anyone who’s looking to purchase an electric grill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect apartment grill
customer_reviews.text: I usually don’t write reviews, however this grill is phenomenal. I always thought that electric equaled grey meat, not at all in this case. I am used to bbq’ing on gas or charcoal grill but recently moved to an apartment that doesn’t allow that. This is like cooking indirectly but directly without any flare ups. As others have said, take 20 minutes to preheat and you are ready to rock and roll. It does get pricey, I added the stand, light, cover, and trays on on the side. However well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: I LOOOOOOVE this grill!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my baby. I thought summer barbecues were over since we're not allowed to have charcoal grills on our balcony in our coop community. But when I took a chance on this it was the best decision I made. I went by peoples reviews here, so glad I listened. OMG! it cooks like a charcoal grill, but cleaner. I can't wait for the warmer weather to start so I can eat outdoors on my electric grill. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Clinton

customer_reviews.title: New and haven't used it but a real pain to assemble BAD CHEEP INSTRUCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: WOULD RECOMMEND AGAINST GETTING THIS DEVICE. IT angers me that the manufacturers don't bother to include better instructions for assembly instead of cheep black and white (really grey and white) illiustrations that take my wife and I SIX HOURS WORKING TOGETHER to assemble this thing and put it together. I don't think i'm stupid. I have 6 years of post doctoral training and my IQ was once measured to be at least 150. (NEVER LET THEM CHECK IT AGAIN AS IT COULD HAVE BEEN AN ERROR)
customer_reviews.author: film lover 60

customer_reviews.title: Hotter and better
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Q140 about 8 years ago on Amazon and was most pleased with it but as the years went by, the upper shell began to peel back and occasionally "rain" on the food so I upgraded to the updated larger grill. I was blown away by the improvement in this new Q240 version! Searing heat, half the grilling time and just Weber magical. Worth the increased price for that and about twice the grilling surface? Oh, hell yeah!!
customer_reviews.author: R Rated

customer_reviews.title: Delightful surprise!
customer_reviews.text: We've been frustrated with condo living. It affects our ability to grill with charcoal. Not fans of propane, we decided to try Weber's electric grill. It's been fabulous! While I am still trying to figure out cooking times, the results are wonderful. Not a true BBQ flavor, but darn good. It's easy to use. Small enough to not hog up the space on the balcony, but big enough to cook a lot of food at one time. This has been a great purchase and we've enjoyed all the food we've cooked on our new grill!
customer_reviews.author: DaisyMae

customer_reviews.title: no temperature gauge
customer_reviews.text: For a grill in this price range, there should be a temperature gauge. This is a major design flaw imo because you otherwise have to rely on the instructions to wait 20 minutes for the grill to heat up; if your cooking style involves changing temperatures while cooking, then this is a definite handicap. The unit functions otherwise as intended. If you are intending to buy the accompanying stand, you should be aware that it DOES NOT have any shelves, which limits its functionality. Had I known this, I would have just purchased a small table at a considerable saving.
customer_reviews.author: KenNYCK

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting greatness and it'll never match up to a charcoal grill. I'm giving it 4 stars for fit and finish and quality. Knocking off a star because you will need to figure out the "hot spots" on this grill. I was hoping since it was electric, Weber would have been able to design the coils to cover. It does a good job for the most part. As far as a grill for a beach condo lanai, it is best in class.
customer_reviews.author: Tex

customer_reviews.title: Parts don't last long and are not available from Weber
customer_reviews.text: Have a Q2400 with cover and stand. Heating element blew and took nearly a month for a replacement from Weber. Shortly after the controller blew. Live in a condo so can only have electric. Weber web site shows part unavailable. Called and they said they do not know when they will get controllers in. First inquired in August and they now say November--maybe. At least were honest in saying they had no idea. Looks as if they come from China. Last Weber I'll buy if from China.
customer_reviews.author: CaptT

customer_reviews.title: Problem
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working less than 6 months. Amazon sent me new grill. Satisfied. This my third grill from Weber. I like the way they cook. The problem was with the power cord assembly. Hope this lasts at least 5 years. I grill about 3-4 times a week.
customer_reviews.author: fmo47

customer_reviews.title: Great Electric Grill!!
customer_reviews.text: The Weber Q2400 is a great electric grill - for times when gas isn't possible - like when you live in an apartment. The grill heats up very uniformly - and gets very hot - such that I can sear steaks in the same way that I sear with gas. The grill is made of typical weber materials - so it feels like I'm grilling with gas. Uniform heat leads to predictable cooking for all the food. Same cleaning as gas grill. Nice that it never runs out of gas - just pug it in! Nothing is as sweet as a real Weber gas grill, but this electric grill is darned close!
customer_reviews.author: Howard Reichel

customer_reviews.title: allow 30 minutes to preheat grill
customer_reviews.text: Hotter than my gas grill. Can sear/cook a steak in 4 minutes a side. Enamel cooking grates are easy to clean! Recommend doing that every 3 or 4 cooking cycles to reduce smoke when cooking. My condo does not allow gas grills on the lanai. this solves the problem. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: DickyV

customer_reviews.title: Quality Convenience
customer_reviews.text: So much better than my old gas grill and considerably safer. Using it almost nightly. Ready to cook with 15 minutes. Quick scrape of the prior nights mess and ready to go again. Good heat distribution. Steaks, chicken, pork and corn all come out delicious. Glad I got this and not the Q 1400. Even for two people it provides added room such as when adding corn to the mix and came in handy Labor Day weekend for a group of four. Not much bigger and both use the same stand.
customer_reviews.author: GARRIGA

customer_reviews.title: WAITING TWO MONTHS FOR REPLACEMENT HEATING ELEMENT!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Electric element died after one season of use. Still under warranty, but after talking with Weber a month ago they have done NOTHING. UPDATE: AFTER 2 MONTHS WAITING FOR PART, I THREW IT IN THE TRASH. JUNK!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ed

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: As a Weber gas grill guy it was tough hearing they didn't allow gas at my condo complex. This was the biggest/most powerful one I could buy at 120vac. It takes a while to heat up. Let it warm up about 30 minutes before you start grilling (perfect for drinks and conversation when the guests arrive) and you'll be OK.
customer_reviews.author: HCS

customer_reviews.title: It’s Weber...Enough Said!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a “Weberite” for many years. We recently downsized into townhome, and I needed to part with my Weber Genesis. Now with a balcony, I wanted a grilling option in the electric grill space. After doing a ton of research, I decided to go with Weber Q 2400. We love our grill!!! It’s a Weber, through and through. Easy to use, cooks to perfection. In grills, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Roy T. Benear

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste time searching
customer_reviews.text: If you are restricted to electric only, this is it.Don't waste time searching, get this, the cover, the cart and a good thermometer. You will be using them frequently. If you are cooking for two, get the Q1400 (recovers temp faster.) True sear marks, real grill taste. Always preheat and keep lid closed.
customer_reviews.author: The_Anarchist

customer_reviews.title: If you're in an RV this is terrific
customer_reviews.text: I purchased mine on June 7th 2018 used it cooking hamburgers and hotdogs so far I really like this in an RV and his terrific also purchase the cart and now I'm trying to look for the cover one of the reasons I purchased this is because I'm tired of running out of gas Weatherby one of the small bottles or one of the regular size bottles then you have to go and get gas bottles charcoal is a nasty mess going to be grilling ribs today highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: flhtxlz

customer_reviews.title: Good Item But Requires Pre Heating and Optional Cart
customer_reviews.text: This is a generally favorable review. Like others, we have struggled a bit with the required pre heating time. It has also been harder than we expected to get accustomed to the heat control. Other than that, it is an attractive, well built unit with a large cooking surface--for an electric grill. We also placed a second order for the companion cart. The actual grill is very heavy relative to the rest of the aluminum unit, and that argues for a good secure way to move it around.
customer_reviews.author: Writer2

customer_reviews.title: Quality and well made
customer_reviews.text: I live in a high rise condo at the beach. Charcoal or propane grills are not allowed. My only option for grilling would be an electric grill. I researched the available ones on the market and chose the Weber 2400. The quality is good and the grill is well made. I have been pleased with the results of grilling a variety of meats. The Weber grill has been worth the price- a good value.
customer_reviews.author: zen-net

customer_reviews.title: Performance of the grill is lacking
customer_reviews.text: The delivery of this grill was great!!! It arrived 2 days later without a scratch, but unfortunately the performance is lacking. The grill doesn't even come close enough to sear a steak or a burger. You would think for a grill at this price point the cooking temp would be a lot higher. I'm very disappointed. If you like to cook your steak low and slow then this is the grill for you. I dont and because of this I cant give this a good review. Sorry Weber but you fell short on this one!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Montero

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful electric grill
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful electric grill ! We do not allowed to use propane gril at balcony and we choose Weber q2490 wow !!fast , easy to clean and storage !!
customer_reviews.author: I. Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Works well but does not have a great range of temperature control.
customer_reviews.text: This grill functions fine for the fact that since I live in apartments, I cannot have gas grills. You must heat this grill for 20 minutes on high to get it to cook well. I pretty much cook on high because the lower temps seem to take a long, long time to cook the food. I am happy with it, as it cooks steaks, chops and hamburger just fine and keeps the meat smell and heat out of my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Tukeen

customer_reviews.title: Good grill however did not come with the drip pan
customer_reviews.text: Forced to go to an electric grill due to fire insurance policy I went with the Weber since I have enjoyed their gas grills. So far so good. I use a smoker box to help with the flavor. Reason for 4 stars is mine did not come with the removable drip pan underneath nor did it come with the aluminum pan. 3 emails to Weber and so far nothing but automated replies saying it is under investigation.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Grill
customer_reviews.text: I have been very impressed and Surprised as this is the first electric grill I have ever used. It heats in 20 minutes as the instructions call for to pre-heat. I definitely sears steaks, pork chops, chicken thighs, as well as great for grilling fresh asparagus spears. I have done a "beercan cornish hen" which turned out great. I doubt there is sufficient room to do a whole beercan chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Happy I purchased but ONE downside....
customer_reviews.text: Love to use it. HATE TO CLEAN IT! the stainless steel lid yellowed so fast and its HARD TO GET OFF. I think it works as well as gas grill probably not as flavorful as coal. Hard to fit a smoke box as the cooking surface is big enough for 2-3 persons. That being said I GRILL on this thing. Fun to have people over and cook outside with out having to worry about fires and flares. Would buy again just need to figure out how to clean it so it looks clean without so much effort.
customer_reviews.author: VIpryncess

customer_reviews.title: Both cooked great and were tasty and flavorlful with only salt seasoning
customer_reviews.text: City doesn't allow propane grills on balconies so I bought this electric model. Pleasantly surprised by the performance. Paired with a smoking box with soaked apple wood chips and made a grilled chicken sandwich. Both cooked great and were tasty and flavorlful with only salt seasoning. Can't recommend this more for apartment dwellers!
customer_reviews.author: Will Lucas

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this Weber grill
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! Amazing control. So convenient. I use it for everything from pizza to pork roasts to a good ‘ol ribeye steak. Anything you can cook on a grill, frying pan or in the oven comes out perfect every time. I cannot have a charcoal grill on my condo deck so this is perfect. Gas grills are overrated in my opinion. The Best grill I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Does not get hot now and won’t clean ..
customer_reviews.text: This grill is so hard to clean. If you don’t soak and clean it after use- it stink! I hate this grill. It doesn’t get hot now. Does not work like it did at first.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: The heating element is not nearly strong enough to maintain adequate cooking temperature. You can’t really use the whole cooking surface because it can’t keep the temperature up and you end up mostly baking your food. I’m annoyed because I can’t return this now. You will be disappointed. Especially if you’re used to a full size gas or charcoal grill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Electric Grill
customer_reviews.text: Finally purchased an electric grill in place of my older Weber electric. This ones far better, it's larger has thick steel grates, you can buy accessories like a stand, side table shelves, a cover, a light and a griddle to replace one of the grates. I bought all of these items to make it more inline with the grill gas Weber I had to replace because of city codes that I loved.
customer_reviews.author: MJF Mpls.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectation
customer_reviews.text: Am pleasantly surprised at the amount of heat this grill generates. I feared it would produce only a moderate amount of heat. Using the "hand temperature" test (regrettably there is no built in thermometer) it would seem to reach a maximum heat about 800 degrees. The temperature control on the side has no numbers, so I labeled it. Even steak cooks nicely at a level 5. 4.5 was too hot for hamburgers. Great device for a city dweller who has restrictions against using charcoal or gas on their balcony.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Very nice electric grill
customer_reviews.text: I have used this several times now (along with Kona grill mats (which make clean up a snap). Well made (what one expects from Weber). It has a nice pull along handle that mounts (and folds) at the bottom of the grill. Grills hamburgers and squash/zucchini very nicely. One thing I would to see in the cover is an accurate grill temperature.
customer_reviews.author: KevMeist

customer_reviews.title: For an electric grill, it does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: If you want the ease of an electric grill or are not allowed to have an open flame where you live, this grill is great. I drilled a hole in the lid and installed a thermometer so I can see the temperature while cooking, which reduces having to lift the lid to check on your food (which will increase cooking time). I was able to fit twelve 1/3 lbs burgers on the grill at one time and cook them in 15 minutes (not including the 20 minute preheat). Not the cheapest electric grill but you get what you pay for. I am happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: gm

customer_reviews.title: Even temp, easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Weber grill previously when I lived in a condo and gas grills were not allowed. I loved how easy it was to clean, that there were no burnt remains (carcinogens) getting on my food from previous meals, and the temperature regulation and evenness was fantastic! I’ve since been using a large propane grill and it has significantly underperformed my old Weber, so I sold it and purchased this model. This is better than my last Weber and I have been extremely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Lord

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: This product is good. But for what i paid for it which is too much. They could have provided a better quality grease drip pan than a dollar tree store version. My disappointment to that. It did all my skewers and jerk chicken. Could use a temperature gauge. Tip to help with grease. Use foil to cover the lower pan as alot grease will add to the mess.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Campbell-Biggs

customer_reviews.title: This grill is AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is AMAZING!!! Cooks just as well as propane or charcoal and once it's heated up it cooks pretty fast. We made steaks on it last night for the first time and I wasn't expecting it to cook as quickly or as well as it did. I wasn't finished making the salads before the steaks were done and they were cooked to perfection. This is the best purchase I've made for the money in years, especially since we live in an apartment and can't have propane or charcoal I the balcony.
customer_reviews.author: MLynn

customer_reviews.title: Great for Snow Country
customer_reviews.text: During the spring, summer and fall, we grill about 2/3 - 3/4 of our dinners. Living in the Northeast, we missed grilling in the winter months. This Weber electric is exactly what we've needed. Assembly was a snap. Since Christmas, I've grilled about 10 times on our screened porch with very good, and improving, results. Still getting used to controlling the temperature. I may be going overboard, but I've been cleaning the cooking grates and drip pan afer each use which is quite easy. I'm hoping the grill will prove to last as long as our outdoor Weber.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H.

customer_reviews.title: Weber Electric grills are every bit as good as gas and much more convenient!
customer_reviews.text: We had the smaller grill first & loved it! When the heating element broke we decided to get the larger model since we sometimes need a larger area. This model doesn’t seem to heat up quite as hot as the smaller one but it’s still ample heat. Enjoy these grills as much as a gas grill.
customer_reviews.author: needabunny

customer_reviews.title: The best electric grill for my Condo Terrace
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Since we live in a NY Condo I use this on my terrace. Can't use gas. This is my second Weber electric. The previous one lasted 5 years. And we used it a lot. This time I got the bigger one. And I like the coated iron grates which my older one did not have. I hope I get as many years out of this one..
customer_reviews.author: Steve Salem

customer_reviews.title: No fuss grill
customer_reviews.text: This is our first electric grill. It has made us some nice bbq dinners. Draws about 12 amps on high setting, which you will most likely use. Give it 20 minutes to heat up. We are satisfied with this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Cygnet

customer_reviews.title: Super Meals
customer_reviews.text: I bought this electric grill for my daughter and son-in-law. On a recent visit, I cooked six different meals on this grill. Each meal turned out nicely cooked with lots of natural meat juices still in the meat. Even my grandsons who are picky eaters enjoyed the various meats we cooked over the eight days we were there. This grill was much easier to use than a charcoal grill. Cleanup was a bit more time consuming, but the grill cleaned up nicely in the kitchen sink with just a plastic brush and dish cloth. The drip pans were also easy to clean, but only needed cleaned about every four meals. I highly recommend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect perfection
customer_reviews.text: Looks ok and works.. but the product was damaged Plastic side handles were all scratch. Pretty disappointed... also front left side of the grill there is a plastic cap covering a hole and I have NO idea what it’s for!!! So frustrating, I got the cart also and this cap pops out when I put the bbq into the car as it sits down to far I bought felt bumpers to make it sit up higher... but I should have to do that... I’ll use the grill tomorrow but I’m disappointed that it’s new and scratched up.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Nathan

customer_reviews.title: No more propane!
customer_reviews.text: We really like this unit. Tired of running out of propane. Unit is a bit heavy. If you leave outside not a concern but we don't leave it outside. Prefer to bring in so the weather doesn't ruin it. Takes a bit to heat up but never an issue. Food tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Grill on the Market!!!
customer_reviews.text: After being a gas grill connoisseur for many years, we recently moved to an apartment building where we could not have our big gas grill anymore! So after much research we chose this one! Setup/Assembly was a very easy and within 30 mins the grill was ready for use! Just like normal gas grilling you need to let the grill warm up but I would say give it 15-20 mins to warm up, once you do it cooks just like a gas grill!!! Even got neighbors asking if we were using charcoal because of the great smells!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Mathieu

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to gas or charcoal grill.
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a 5 year old Weber grill of the same type. This is the perfect grill for apartments and condos that will not permit gas or charcoal. Gives a great flavor and cooks quickly with the lid closed. I like the ability to control the temperature and the double lined lid prevents the exterior from getting extremely hot. It is easier and safer to use than either gas or charcoal. Very portable and Weber has a mounting cart that give it free standing capability. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: richard s earle

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor grilling. Easy to manage.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to store. Easy to clean. Easy to grill. It does take a little longer to grill when compared to a coal grill, but there is no mess, cleanup of coal after grilling. If you grill occasionally or frequently this grill is for you. We enjoyed grilling this summer. It can be heavy to lift with the grill plates inside, but if lifted in its separate parts it is easy to carry. The grill grates are solid and the most heavy part of the grill.
customer_reviews.author: drpret

customer_reviews.title: Beware.
customer_reviews.text: The grill worked fine for the first several uses. Now, it takes a VERY LONG TIME to cook a burger. In fact, it too 45 mins to cook six burgers. I am appalled by their customer service> I created a complaint and received acknowledgment about 6 weeks later and now it’s been at least another 6 weeks without ANY follow up. Visually it is appealing and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sharilyn

customer_reviews.title: Consistently Great Grilling
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a condo like I do and you're not allowed to use either gas or charcoal which we are not, this Weber electric grill is a very good alternative! One thing that it does better than either gas or charcoal is that it cooks perfectly consistently every time and no matter what part of the grill you use. I really love this grill and would recommend it to anyone in a condo or apartment setting where fire is not allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Foster III

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Than My Old Electric Grill
customer_reviews.text: My old grill never seemed to get hot enough, especially on a chilly day. This grill gives food nice grill marks and texture. It is large enough to fit a cast iron griddle and cast iron frying pan, so it is even more versatile for different cooking methods outside.
customer_reviews.author: Dale I

customer_reviews.title: A great alternative grill
customer_reviews.text: This is my first electric grill and was necessitated by living in an apartment complex that bans gas and charcoal versions. Unlike other reviewers, I find no problem with this grills' ability to heat high enough to give nicely colored grill marks. Following the manufacture's recommended preheat time of twenty minutes has provided excellent results on all meats and vegetables that I have tried. The variable temperature control allows wide latitude and gives the user many options for the specific requirements of the food being cooked. No, it doesn't give the "smoky" flavor of a charcoal grill, but in an environment that bans charcoal because of the smoke and propane because of the storage hazards, this is a superior alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Mayes

customer_reviews.title: Use 15 amp outdoor extension, 2-3ft
customer_reviews.text: My first one, last week, perfect. Cooked fast. even heat, a dream...but..the breaker would trip when grill turned off. Here is the good part...sent req for return....no problem..got new grill today. As usual..Weber the best in products and customer service
customer_reviews.author: dricx

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative for apartment living.  BUT IT COULD BE BETTER!
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of meals, we're content. It ain't gas, but it's better than the oven. The day after unpacking my Q2400 we went into a hardware store with the Q series grills. Several had folding trays with nice workspace. According to Weber service, there are no trays available for the electric grills. The handle of my grill has holes for the trays. COME ON WEBER, WHY NOT OFFER THIS BASIC AMENITY?
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Let the grill heat up on high for at least 20 minutes before starting to cook.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent grill if you can't have a regular charcoal grill. I've had it for about a month and have grilled on it at least once a week--steaks, burgers, bacon-wrapped scallops, bratwurst, and veggies--and can report that it does sear steaks and in general does a great job at basic grilling. It's easy to clean, too. The little drip pans are a must if you plan to grill on a balcony. Other useful tips--make sure to let it heat up on high for at least 20 minutes before grilling and keep the lid closed so that the heat doesn't escape.
customer_reviews.author: nelms

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use Can take it apart easily after cooking throw grill parts in the sink and clean. No more scrubbing a grill! Rec use at highest temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie's Kids

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I am not much of a griller, but I love this thing. I have it on a covered deck off the kitchen. It doesn't take up too much space, but can still cook a lot of food at once. It cleans very easily with a brush and the drip pan is big and easy to remove/switch. This grill gets hot enough to sear steaks and so far cooks in a very predictable way. I'll see how it holds up in the long run, but right now I couldn't be happier. Well worth the money and glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen80

customer_reviews.title: Not a replacement for charcoal
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad grill, if you can't use charcoal, but it doesn't really get hot enough. Won't get grates hot enough to burn off old food which makes grates hard to clean. Definitely need to season before using in order to get any "grill flavor".
customer_reviews.author: Dan Scott

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit but didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the cost. Others were less but flimsy. This is very heavy and solid. Grilled a steak perfectly. Get the drop pans too. UPDATE: Same feelings about the grill after using it many times. Well worth the extra cost. Don't buy a cheap, its worth the 2x cost. Rock solid. Easy to clean. Perfect cooking. . UPDATE: After just 6 months, it went dead. Fewer than 15 uses. No power at all. Returned it. Loved it up to that point. Kept in a garage out of the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Loved it at first but....
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill. I have had it for several months. It is perfect. My brother who thinks he is a natural born griller was shocked at how tender and tasty his ribs were. I did not want to bother with coal or gas. This really allows a tasty flavor to your food. It gets good and hot really fast. Love this grill!! Update 08/05/2018 The grill started catching fire. It tripped my breaker several times. I feel that a grill that cost $299.00 should last longer than 2.5 years. Very disappointed. Replacement parts are too costly. It no longer works :-)
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: This grill is amazing. I was skeptical because of prior experiences with ...
customer_reviews.text: This grill is amazing. I was skeptical because of prior experiences with electric grills. This gets very hot and sears meat better than some gas grills I’ve used. Takes some time to heat up (20-25 minutes) but that’s fine with me. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: DomAuc

customer_reviews.title: Great for my balcony
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill for my apartment balcony. Nicely laid out...food comes out great. A little pricey..temp..control could be better
customer_reviews.author: Anicehuman

customer_reviews.title: A two minute set up and 20 minute pre heat ...
customer_reviews.text: A two minute set up and 20 minute pre heat and this grill outperformed my two previous very expensive electric grills. The simple fact that the heating element is controlled by a rheostat instead of circuit boards should make it less subject to the salt air that has destroyed my previous grills that used circuit boards for temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: mvadventure

customer_reviews.title: Great for an electric grill
customer_reviews.text: For an electric grill this sears and cooks very well. I still prefer gas or charcoal...but if you live in an unreasonably ruled suburban outpost that won't allow gas or charcoal then this is a great grill for you. Even if not forced to have to use electric I would still think this was a great grill. Excellent heat...excellent grill marks.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: read a lot of reviews
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and was hesitant about electric grills. Never had one before. Got a lot of thick steaks. Use this when it was 40° outside. Cooked it perfectly. Have no reservations recommending this
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Holds the heat very well. Cooks steaks and burgers well.Nice size.
customer_reviews.text: We had a non Weber electric BBQ before this one and it didn't hold heat well enough for steaks and burgers. This one is perfect. it has expanded our grilling options. The only downside is I wish it had a temperature gauge so you could red the temperature of the grill. I would highly recommend this BBQ.We also bought the vegetable basket which has a saute pan. It is very useful and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: A great electric grill!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good heat output, large cooking surface, easy to clean, and very sturdy. Make sure you let it heat up if you want to get good sear marks. In the winter, it can take some time to get hot - that's just a fact of life. I live in a condo, and this grill is perfect for me. I have tried smaller grills, and this is worth the extra money. I cook on it all year round.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL SIMBULAN

customer_reviews.title: Loving it in Brooklyn
customer_reviews.text: As a New Yorker who doesn't want to break the law, this grill is great! I also purchased a stand and really love grilling on my patio. There are cool spots along the edges where food gets less hot, but all in all, it does the trick and was well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: I love it except for two flaws
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth "Q" grill. I love it except for two flaws. They do not advertise side tables for it, which is a deviation from the two smaller "Q"s and the large gas "Q", and a definitely noticed shortage. The second item needing improving is the electric control. The unit is too close to the underside of the handle, making rotation difficult. And, as in the smaller grill, the indicator light is hard to distinguish in daylight, the time I prefer to grill. Checking the temperature before grilling on a 25 degree day, my digital heat gun registered 758 degrees after warmup. This will definitely put grill marks on your steaks!
customer_reviews.author: Bridgeman

customer_reviews.title: We love a BBQ (being expat Aussies) but as we live ...
customer_reviews.text: We love a BBQ (being expat Aussies) but as we live in a condo the rules only allowed an electric BBQ. We were unsure how well this would work, but have been really very pleasantly surprised. The food has cooked well, tasted just like we are used to on a gas BBQ, and it's easy to clean. We were pleased we bought the bigger grill size and are extremely happy. The only thing I would have liked was if the electric version has the side flaps to put things down on, but other than that, really happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Staines

customer_reviews.title: great grill for condo living
customer_reviews.text: The steaks we made for our first meal on the grill came out perfectly. The grill heated up quickly and was easy to operate. We are prohibited from having a gas grill at our condo and this is a great alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Bsf

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This little electric grill is awesome for grilling all your favorites...if you live in an apartment or condo complex where the fire code does not allow gas grills this is a must...the temp control is easy and the cook guide that comes along with the grill is spot on
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best electric grill ever
customer_reviews.text: The best electric grill ever! I have had electric grills in the past but none have had as large a cooking surface as this one. It is very sturdy but not too heavy, and it heats up extremely fast. You will pay more for the Weber name, but it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grills well
customer_reviews.text: We like this. It’s small, easy to move around, but does it’s job well. We grill on it a lot during the summer and then jut put it in the basement during winter.
customer_reviews.author: Karen 6

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I had a Weber Q gas grill for several years and was getting tired of running out of gas, flare-ups, trying to keep it clean, etc. I purchased the q2400 and am very happy I did. It cooks well, no flare-ups, easy to get well seared, rare steak, and super easy to clean. I especially like that the liner is removable for cleaning. Everyone who has food from this grill can't believe that it's electric. One of the best, useable products I've purchased in years. You will not regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: ASAP-salem

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first electric grill that I have used and so far works very well. It definitely is not a gas grill but cooks steak and shrimp very nicely. When I seasoned the grill it held in the heat very nicely (will have to wait for the NY winter to see how it does then). My one complaint was that it doesn't have a built in thermometer; however, to solve that issue I purchased an oven one that works fine.
customer_reviews.author: The Stig

customer_reviews.title: I love this grill!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is just awesome! It gets super hot and leaves nice char marks on the meat. We use it all the time and the only regret is that I waited this long to get it. We are unable to grill with flame because of condo rules but this changes everything. The cart is a necessary accessory and on the advice of a friend I bought copper grilling mats and they really keep my grill clean. The grill and stand are expensive but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: justin hoover

customer_reviews.title: Get hot for an electric grill an hold its temperature reasonably well.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent grill. Definitely a quality product and much, much better than the George Foreman grill I purchased that broke within a month. This grill is not cheap, but it is worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Cyclonerex

customer_reviews.title: Seems OK so far
customer_reviews.text: I had two of the gas ones and the regulators kept failing, last time I didn't even get one summer from a brand new regulator. So I got the electric one. So far so good, it seems to get hot enough. Its winter now so it will be next summer before it gets heavy use. I am hopeful
customer_reviews.author: peter meyers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my boat slip
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Does take a few minutes to heat up, but gets plenty hot for searing and cooking great steaks. Better then having small bottles of gas around for the old grill.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R

customer_reviews.title: Great while it worked properly.
customer_reviews.text: After using for 9 months the electric coils are not nearly as hot as when the grill was new. When I replace this it won't be another Weber.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley H.

customer_reviews.title: Good electric grill!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good and powerful grill in its category of electric grills. If you need to go with an electric grill for whatever reason, I would recommend this. Need to get the Rolling Cart to use it outdoors like a real grill. Easy to take pieces involved in cooking off and clean them in the kitchen, so it stays new for long.
customer_reviews.author: Meric Topbas

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill!!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is just as good as my Charcoal one..We got it for our beach condo to comply with local regulations...turn it on high, and u will sear a steak well.. Id recommend a short heavy gauge drop cord if you don't have it near the outlet. The grill draws a lot of current and could trip your breaker if you try using a long extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is sort of like an electric skillet with a grate for outside. Nothing like charcoal or propane
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: It is a great grill. I bought it because we cannot have gas or caol grills in our condominium. It is surprisingly good, and definitely replaces a small gas grill. I can make barbecue for 10-15 people easily on it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied. Grill is made quite well and especially like ...
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied. Grill is made quite well and especially like the grates---heavy, sturdy will last a long time. Heats quite well and am satisfied with the grilling. If you need a grill that can't be gas or charcoal---this electric one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these the big one and a smaller one and both of these electric grill work perfectly. These heat up fairly quickly and hold the heat well. We keep one in our camper to use so we don't heat up the inside of the camper. If power ever goes out we fire up the generator to grill. You can't go wrong with Weber!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BrokenBackJack

customer_reviews.title: It worked great, much better than we ever expected
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to go with our new RV which is all electric. We tried this out at home before our next RV trip. It worked great, much better than we ever expected. We have another larger smoker electric grill but it does not do as good as job as this grill. We are glad we purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: This is such an easy grill to cook with and super easy to clean. The temps are a breeze to control. I really am enjoying this grill. The size accomadates large and small portions.
customer_reviews.author: Aupapillon

customer_reviews.title: Convenience and Efficiency.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this grill about 2 months ago and we have grilled more in this time than ever before. Living on the third floor can be a hindrance to running up and down the stairs to grill; no more. The Weber electric grill fits nicely on a table on the front porch, has ample grill space and an extremely efficient heat control. I can't stop telling friends about it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Haire

customer_reviews.title: This grill works great. We had to change from propane to electric ...
customer_reviews.text: This grill works great. We had to change from propane to electric because of condo regulations and this turned out to be a great option. It gets hot enough to sear meat without the flareups that can happen with drippings on the propane grill.
customer_reviews.author: F. Kowalonek

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a 5 Star!!  Hot hot hot!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I had the smaller one for several years in a harsh environment and was happy with it. This one is larger, has much better grilling surface and gets much hotter. It also has its own gfi which is great in the environment I use it in! A definite 5 star!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patti J Jones

customer_reviews.title: Should have purchased sooner
customer_reviews.text: This Weber grill is much better than the smaller model we purchased previously. Not only is it larger, the heating element on this grill is much better
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Dauenhauer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Weber Grill!
customer_reviews.text: Great grill! Excellent for smaller decks and for condos that do not allow gas grills. Love the cast iron grill surface and quality build of this weber grill. Really high quality. Actually like this better than gas or charcoal. It takes about 20 min. to pre-heat the grill, but then you're ready to go. Cooks evenly and quickly! Highly recommend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: sol1

customer_reviews.title: This is our second electric grill. We will always ...
customer_reviews.text: This is our second electric grill. We will always prefer gas but we now live in a condo that forbids gas. Chars steaks, grills ribs. Really outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Kimages

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of propane or wood fire grills and this is perfect for cooking outside. You are able to control the temperature and perfect size to cook for a party of 10-12 people.
customer_reviews.author: Bijou's Collectibles

customer_reviews.title: Versatile electric grill
customer_reviews.text: Plan to take to Mexico for cooking/smoking various meats. Seems to keep a steady temperature when you set it on each temperature line. Have used it in the garage during the winter to bbq several meats when it would have been difficult to use the outdoor Weber grill.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great grill!
customer_reviews.text: Love having a grill to use on our 2nd floor patio in our apartment bldg.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Weber 55020001 Q 2400 Electric Grill
product_meta.description: Style:GrillRestyled for 2014, the Weber Q 240 is now the Weber Q 2400. The grill has the same great performance and sleek styling, but adds new aesthetics that are both functional and fun, including larger grip handle and control knobs, ergonomic side handles, sturdy front and rear cradles plus the familiar Weber Q logo branded in the lid. The Weber Q 2400 Electric grill raises the bar on flavor expectations and performance of an electric grill. Sear burgers, steaks and chops; grill chicken, fish, vegetables and fruit on the porcelain-enameled cast-iron grates. You'll be amazed at the authentic grilled taste of foods cooked on this electric grill. The Weber Q 2400 grill is fully featured, yet space-saving and portable - just the ticket for grillers living in condos or any residence where restrictions govern gas and charcoal grill usage. May be used with the 2014 Weber Q Portable Cart model #6557 and Q Cart model #6525. Weber Q 2400 is for outdoor use only.
feature_bullets: 1560-watt electric heating element to heat 280 square-inch total cooking area
Porcelain-enameled cast-iron cooking grates and cast aluminum lid and body
Fully assembled out of box, Infinite control burner valve settings. Fuel type-Electric. Power-1,560 W/120 V
6-foot grounded cord. The appliance should be supplied through a residual current device (RCD) having a rated residual operating current not exceeding 30 mA
3D interactive assembly instructions for this product are available through the free BILT app.
.Dimensions (Inches) Lid Open : ( H x W x D) - 26 x 31.5 x 25.1(Inches); :Dimensions - Lid Closed (inches) 14.5 H x 31.5 W x 19.5 D

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
